intro: Oreosparte celebica, commonly known as the Celebes spartia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Celebes (Sulawesi) in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of grasses. It is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Oreosparte celebica is considered a rare and potentially vulnerable species.
